nodes.Name: Isaac Newton
nodes.Summary: Developed the laws of motion and universal gravitation; foundational work in calculus; authored Principia Mathematica.

nodes.Name: Roger Cotes
nodes.Summary: Co-editor of Newton's Principia Mathematica; known for Cotes' theorem in trigonometry and logarithms.

nodes.Name: Robert Hooke
nodes.Summary: Formulated Hooke's Law of elasticity; contributions to microscopy, architecture, and astronomy; coined the term "cell".

nodes.Name: Robert Smith
nodes.Summary: Contributions to optics; author of A Compleat System of Opticks; influential in the study of telescopes.

nodes.Name: Stephen Whisson
nodes.Summary: Focus on classical studies at Cambridge; contributions to mathematics teaching.

nodes.Name: Walter Taylor
nodes.Summary: Contributions to geometry and mathematical education.

nodes.Name: James Pound
nodes.Summary: Contributions to astronomy, particularly in lunar and planetary observations.

nodes.Name: John Cranke
nodes.Summary: Mathematician known for contributions to Cambridge mathematical education.

nodes.Name: Thomas Postelthwaite
nodes.Summary: Cambridge academic; contributed to the growth of mathematical scholarship.

nodes.Name: James Bradley
nodes.Summary: Discovery of the aberration of starlight; contributed to understanding Earth's motion.

nodes.Name: Thomas Jones
nodes.Summary: Mathematician and educator; contributed to mathematical textbooks.

nodes.Name: Adam Sedgwick
nodes.Summary: Founding figure in modern geology; named the Cambrian and Devonian geological periods.

nodes.Name: William Hopkins
nodes.Summary: Renowned mathematics tutor; "father of the wranglers" for mentoring top Cambridge mathematicians.

nodes.Name: George Gabriel Stokes
nodes.Summary: Stokes' Theorem; groundbreaking work in fluid dynamics, optics, and light scattering.

nodes.Name: James Clark Maxwell
nodes.Summary: Formulated Maxwell's equations of electromagnetism; made major contributions to the kinetic theory of gases.

nodes.Name: Edward Routh
nodes.Summary: Contributions to classical mechanics and stability theory; developed the Routh-Hurwitz stability criterion.

nodes.Name: Lord Rayleigh
nodes.Summary: Work on wave theory, acoustics, and optics; discovered argon.

nodes.Name: JJ Thompson
nodes.Summary: Discovered the electron and isotopes; contributions to atomic structure theory.

nodes.Name: Niels Bohr
nodes.Summary: Developed the Bohr model of the atom; foundational contributions to quantum mechanics.

nodes.Name: Micheal Foster
nodes.Summary: Physiologist; contributions to the development of modern biology in Cambridge.

nodes.Name: John Newport Langley
nodes.Summary: Contributions to neuroscience; discovered the autonomic nervous system.

nodes.Name: William Whiston
nodes.Summary: Successor to Isaac Newton as Lucasian Professor of Mathematics; contributions to biblical and scientific works.

nodes.Name: William Morley Fletcher
nodes.Summary: Work in public health; Fletcher Report led to reforms in British medical education.

nodes.Name: Archibald Hill
nodes.Summary: Pioneer in biophysics and physiology; studies on muscle mechanics

nodes.Name: Ernest Rutherford
nodes.Summary: Discovered the nucleus; father of nuclear physics.

nodes.Name: Ralph Fowler
nodes.Summary: Contributions to quantum statistics and astrophysics.

nodes.Name: Douglas Raynor Hartree
nodes.Summary: Work on numerical analysis and differential equations; development of the Hartree-Fock method in quantum mechanics.

nodes.Name: Michael Berry
nodes.Summary: Berry phase in quantum mechanics; extensive work in mathematical physics.

nodes.Name: Christopher Howls
nodes.Summary: Contributions to asymptotics and mathematical physics.

nodes.Name: Barry Welch
nodes.Summary: Contributions in modern mathematical research and mentoring.

nodes.Name: Phillip Langman
nodes.Summary: Early-career contributions to applied mathematics.

nodes.Name: William Sharpey
nodes.Summary: Known as the "father of British physiology"; key figure in experimental biology; professor at University College London.

nodes.Name: John Fulton
nodes.Summary: Neurophysiologist; significant contributions to neurophysiology and medical history; co-founded Yale’s Department of the History of Medicine.

nodes.Name: James Jurin
nodes.Summary: Promoted smallpox inoculation; contributed to epidemiology and fluid dynamics research.
